titleStmt.title: A Scheme for erecting a friendly society for insuring lives being a beneficial proposal for all persons possesed of any bishops, dean and chapter leases, or any other lease or leases determinable on one or more life or lives, annuities in the exchequer, or places : as also a certain advantage to all clergymen and other persons, who are desirous to make some provision for their wives and children, or relations, after their decease, by insuring to their wives and children, or such others as they shall appoint, a considerable dividend out of 100000 1. on his, her, or their deaths.

A Scheme for erecting a friendly society for insuring lives being a beneficial proposal for all persons possesed of any bishops, dean and chapter leases, or any other lease or leases determinable on one or more life or lives, annuities in the exchequer, or places : as also a certain advantage to all clergymen and other persons, who are desirous to make some provision for their wives and children, or relations, after their decease, by insuring to their wives and children, or such others as they shall appoint, a considerable dividend out of 100000 1. on his, her, or their deaths.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the British Library.
